intro: Carex renschiana var. brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stemmed sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known for their distinctive floral structures. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are typically borne on short, often hidden stems. It thrives in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting a variety of wildlife.
